name: Find the Duplicate Number
title: Find the Duplicate Number
content:
Given an array of integers nums containing n + 1 integers where each integer is in the range [1, n] inclusive.

There is only one repeated number in nums, return this repeated number.

You must solve the problem without modifying the array nums and using only constant extra space.

 

Example 1:

Input: nums = [1,3,4,2,2]
Output: 2

Example 2:

Input: nums = [3,1,3,4,2]
Output: 3

Example 3:

Input: nums = [3,3,3,3,3]
Output: 3

 

Constraints:

  • 1 <= n <= 105
  • nums.length == n + 1
  • 1 <= nums[i] <= n
  • All the integers in nums appear only once except for precisely one integer which appears two or more times.

 

Follow up:

  • How can we prove that at least one duplicate number must exist in nums?
  • Can you solve the problem in linear runtime complexity?

discussion_posts.name: luanct
discussion_posts.content: I remembered I knew how to solve this question after watching this video LOL\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pKO9UjSeLew

discussion_posts.name: deleted_user
discussion_posts.content:
In constraints the problem says

`
All the integers in nums appear only once except for precisely one integer which appears two or more times.
`

it should be updated to 
`
All the integers in nums appear at most once except for precisely one integer which appears two or more times.
`

discussion_posts.name: johnnychang
discussion_posts.content: No one in this world can solve it in a 45 mins interview with optimal solution without already seen this question.

discussion_posts.name: lord_of_the_bits
discussion_posts.content: [2,2,2,2,2]\n \n How is the above input valid?

discussion_posts.name: kishan9192
discussion_posts.content:
One of the solutions mentioned uses Sorting, 
It's written in the constraints that **You must not modify the array, assume it's read only**

discussion_posts.name: baba_sunilo
discussion_posts.content:
Attention all the people who are complaining that [2, 2, 2, 2,2]. The problem statement says that all the integers in array are in the range of 1 to n , and only one number is repeated. But the problem doesn't say that the integer that is repeated, is repeated only twice, so the repeated integer can be repeated more than twice . 
They specifically mentioned this in the constraints => "All the integers in nums appear only once except for precisely one integer which appears two or more times.".
Hence [2,2,2,2,2] is valid af.
